pullrequest.title: Pose frame semantics: describe legacy behavior

content.raw:
My suggestion would be to create another example to demonstrate how the joint frame is defined relative to the child link. If you are saying the link frames are indeed in the middle of the ellipses, then the URDF and SDF are not equivalent. But this example is trying to demonstrate how we get equivalent representations in the two formats. 

In other words, if I run `gz sdf -p` on the URDF file, the output SDF file should have the joint and the link frames collocated (and it does). I was working out this example in Rviz and Gazebo to check the two:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<robot name="testrobot" xmlns:xacro="http://www.ros.org/wiki/xacro">
  <link name="link1">
    <inertial>
      <mass value="1"/>
    </inertial>
  </link>

  <joint name="joint1" type="revolute">
    <origin rpy='0 0 0' xyz='0.1 0.2 0'/>
    <parent link="link1"/>
    <child link="link2"/>
    <axis xyz="0 0 1"/>
    <limit lower="-3.14" upper="3.14" effort="1000" velocity="5"/>
  </joint>
  <link name="link2">
    <inertial>
      <mass value="1"/>
    </inertial>
  </link>

  <joint name="joint2" type="revolute">
    <origin rpy='0 0 1.5707963267948966' xyz='0 0.2 0'/>
    <parent link="link1"/>
    <child link="link3"/>
    <axis xyz="0 0 1"/>
    <limit lower="-3.14" upper="3.14" effort="1000" velocity="5"/>
  </joint>
  <link name="link3">
    <inertial>
      <mass value="1"/>
    </inertial>
  </link>

  <joint name="joint3" type="revolute">
    <origin rpy='0 0 -1.5707963267948966' xyz='0.2 0 0'/>
    <parent link="link3"/>
    <child link="link4"/>
    <axis xyz="0 0 1"/>
    <limit lower="-3.14" upper="3.14" effort="1000" velocity="5"/>
  </joint>
  <link name="link4">
    <inertial>
      <mass value="1"/>
    </inertial>
  </link>
</robot>
```

And here is equivalent SDF (using `gz sdf`). Notice that the joint tags don't have a `<pose>` element.

```
<sdf version='1.6'>
  <model name='testrobot'>
    <link name='link1'>
      <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
        <mass>1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0</ixz>
          <iyy>0</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
    </link>
    <link name='link2'>
      <pose frame=''>0.1 0.2 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
        <mass>1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0</ixz>
          <iyy>0</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
    </link>
    <joint name='joint1' type='revolute'>
      <child>link2</child>
      <parent>link1</parent>
      <axis>
        <xyz>0 0 1</xyz>
        <limit>
          <lower>-3.14</lower>
          <upper>3.14</upper>
          <effort>1000</effort>
          <velocity>5</velocity>
        </limit>
        <dynamics>
          <spring_reference>0</spring_reference>
          <spring_stiffness>0</spring_stiffness>
        </dynamics>
        <use_parent_model_frame>1</use_parent_model_frame>
      </axis>
    </joint>
    <link name='link3'>
      <pose frame=''>0 0.2 0 0 -0 1.5708</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
        <mass>1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0</ixz>
          <iyy>0</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
    </link>
    <joint name='joint2' type='revolute'>
      <child>link3</child>
      <parent>link1</parent>
      <axis>
        <xyz>0 0 1</xyz>
        <limit>
          <lower>-3.14</lower>
          <upper>3.14</upper>
          <effort>1000</effort>
          <velocity>5</velocity>
        </limit>
        <dynamics>
          <spring_reference>0</spring_reference>
          <spring_stiffness>0</spring_stiffness>
        </dynamics>
        <use_parent_model_frame>1</use_parent_model_frame>
      </axis>
    </joint>
    <link name='link4'>
      <pose frame=''>0 0.4 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
        <mass>1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0</ixz>
          <iyy>0</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
    </link>
    <joint name='joint3' type='revolute'>
      <child>link4</child>
      <parent>link3</parent>
      <axis>
        <xyz>0 0 1</xyz>
        <limit>
          <lower>-3.14</lower>
          <upper>3.14</upper>
          <effort>1000</effort>
          <velocity>5</velocity>
        </limit>
        <dynamics>
          <spring_reference>0</spring_reference>
          <spring_stiffness>0</spring_stiffness>
        </dynamics>
        <use_parent_model_frame>1</use_parent_model_frame>
      </axis>
    </joint>
  </model>
</sdf>
```
content.html:
My suggestion would be to create another example to demonstrate how the joint frame is defined relative to the child link. If you are saying the link frames are indeed in the middle of the ellipses, then the URDF and SDF are not equivalent. But this example is trying to demonstrate how we get equivalent representations in the two formats.

In other words, if I run gz sdf -p on the URDF file, the output SDF file should have the joint and the link frames collocated (and it does). I was working out this example in Rviz and Gazebo to check the two:

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<robot name="testrobot" xmlns:xacro="http://www.ros.org/wiki/xacro">
  <link name="link1">
    <inertial>
      <mass value="1"/>
    </inertial>
  </link>

  <joint name="joint1" type="revolute">
    <origin rpy='0 0 0' xyz='0.1 0.2 0'/>
    <parent link="link1"/>
    <child link="link2"/>
    <axis xyz="0 0 1"/>
    <limit lower="-3.14" upper="3.14" effort="1000" velocity="5"/>
  </joint>
  <link name="link2">
    <inertial>
      <mass value="1"/>
    </inertial>
  </link>

  <joint name="joint2" type="revolute">
    <origin rpy='0 0 1.5707963267948966' xyz='0 0.2 0'/>
    <parent link="link1"/>
    <child link="link3"/>
    <axis xyz="0 0 1"/>
    <limit lower="-3.14" upper="3.14" effort="1000" velocity="5"/>
  </joint>
  <link name="link3">
    <inertial>
      <mass value="1"/>
    </inertial>
  </link>

  <joint name="joint3" type="revolute">
    <origin rpy='0 0 -1.5707963267948966' xyz='0.2 0 0'/>
    <parent link="link3"/>
    <child link="link4"/>
    <axis xyz="0 0 1"/>
    <limit lower="-3.14" upper="3.14" effort="1000" velocity="5"/>
  </joint>
  <link name="link4">
    <inertial>
      <mass value="1"/>
    </inertial>
  </link>
</robot>

And here is equivalent SDF (using gz sdf). Notice that the joint tags don't have a <pose> element.

<sdf version='1.6'>
  <model name='testrobot'>
    <link name='link1'>
      <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
        <mass>1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0</ixz>
          <iyy>0</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
    </link>
    <link name='link2'>
      <pose frame=''>0.1 0.2 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
        <mass>1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0</ixz>
          <iyy>0</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
    </link>
    <joint name='joint1' type='revolute'>
      <child>link2</child>
      <parent>link1</parent>
      <axis>
        <xyz>0 0 1</xyz>
        <limit>
          <lower>-3.14</lower>
          <upper>3.14</upper>
          <effort>1000</effort>
          <velocity>5</velocity>
        </limit>
        <dynamics>
          <spring_reference>0</spring_reference>
          <spring_stiffness>0</spring_stiffness>
        </dynamics>
        <use_parent_model_frame>1</use_parent_model_frame>
      </axis>
    </joint>
    <link name='link3'>
      <pose frame=''>0 0.2 0 0 -0 1.5708</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
        <mass>1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0</ixz>
          <iyy>0</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
    </link>
    <joint name='joint2' type='revolute'>
      <child>link3</child>
      <parent>link1</parent>
      <axis>
        <xyz>0 0 1</xyz>
        <limit>
          <lower>-3.14</lower>
          <upper>3.14</upper>
          <effort>1000</effort>
          <velocity>5</velocity>
        </limit>
        <dynamics>
          <spring_reference>0</spring_reference>
          <spring_stiffness>0</spring_stiffness>
        </dynamics>
        <use_parent_model_frame>1</use_parent_model_frame>
      </axis>
    </joint>
    <link name='link4'>
      <pose frame=''>0 0.4 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <inertial>
        <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
        <mass>1</mass>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>0</ixx>
          <ixy>0</ixy>
          <ixz>0</ixz>
          <iyy>0</iyy>
          <iyz>0</iyz>
          <izz>0</izz>
        </inertia>
      </inertial>
    </link>
    <joint name='joint3' type='revolute'>
      <child>link4</child>
      <parent>link3</parent>
      <axis>
        <xyz>0 0 1</xyz>
        <limit>
          <lower>-3.14</lower>
          <upper>3.14</upper>
          <effort>1000</effort>
          <velocity>5</velocity>
        </limit>
        <dynamics>
          <spring_reference>0</spring_reference>
          <spring_stiffness>0</spring_stiffness>
        </dynamics>
        <use_parent_model_frame>1</use_parent_model_frame>
      </axis>
    </joint>
  </model>
</sdf>
